ARABIC: كَأَن لَّمْ يَغْنَوْا۟ فِيهَآ أَلَآ إِنَّ ثَمُودَا۟ كَفَرُوا۟ رَبَّهُمْ أَلَا بُعْدًا لِّثَمُودَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: It was as if thev had never lived there at all. Yes indeed! Thamud rejected their Lord. So awav with Thamud!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: As though they had never lived there at all. Beware! The people of Thamud turned away from their Lord. Beware! Accursed are the people of Thamud.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: as though they had never lived there before. Oh, verily the Thamud denied their Lord! Oh, the Thamud were destroyed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: as though they had never existed. The people of Thamud denied the existence of their Lord. How distant from the mercy of God had the people of Thamud gone!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: As if they had never lived there; indeed the tribe of Thamud disbelieved in their Lord; away with the Thamud!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: As if they had never lived there. No doubt! Verily, Thamud disbelieved in their Lord. So away with Thamud!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: As though they had never dwelt in them; now surely did Samood disbelieve in their Lord; now surely, away with Samood.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: as if they never dwelt there: 'Surely Thamood disbelieved in their Lord, so away with Thamood!'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: As though they had not dwelt there. Lo! Thamud disbelieved in their Lord. A far removal for Thamud!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: as if they had never dwelt there. The Thamud denied their Lord; cursed are the tribe of Thamud.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: As though they had never lived at ease therein. Lo! verily Thamud disbelieved in their Lord. Lo! away with Thamud.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: as if they had never lived there. Behold! Thamud indeed defied their Lord. Now, away with Thamud!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: As if they had never dwelt and flourished there. Ah! Behold! for the Thamud rejected their Lord and Cherisher! Ah! Behold! removed (from sight) were the Thamud!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: As if they had never lived there. No doubt! Verily, Thamud disbelieved in their Lord. So away with Thamud!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: as though they had never lived there. Indeed, Thamood disbelieved in their Lord. So, begone Thamood.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: As if they had never prospered therein. Indeed, Thamood rejected their Lord, so away with Thamood.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: As if they had never prospered therein. Unquestionably, Thamud denied their Lord; then, away with Thamud.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [11:68] as if (ka-an had been softened and its subject omitted, in other words [understand it as] ka’annahum) they had not dwelt there, in their dwelling-place: ‘Lo! Thamūd disbelieved in their Lord, lo! away with Thamūd!’ (this may be read, declined, li-Thamūdan, or left, as indeclinable, li-Thamūda, referring to the district or the tribe).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (As though they had not dwelt there) it was as if they never lived on this earth. (Lo! Thamud) the people of Salih (disbelieved in their Lord. A far removal for Thamud!) the people of Salih are far removed from Allah's mercy.
